column4: ok so we should be able to do that with a liveusb I would think
de-lvm you system?  you will need to create a disk with none lvm and copy the files to that
oh I guess I'm not sure what you want you can have ext4 on lvm
? I want to copy all my diles from my partitions on my lvm to my external hd
ok the just sudo cp -a /root/of/sorce/mount/  /root/of/destination/moun/  and that will be done.  do you know how to mount partitions?
Ummm... I can't mount them because lvm2 isnt installed
the disk is already in lvm2 format?
Yeah
also the livecd iso for alternate adition has the lvm stuf built in
but I think you can install the needed packages on that live session to do the job, I'll find the packages
I know the packages. They wont install because vmlinuz is not accessible from usb
ok try the alternate adition then
Im using the desktop one
yes I understand but desktop live kernel seems to not have the needed stuf
Ive already installed it,
Ive already done this before. I just tried to do it from the usb startup disk, but apparently thats not possible
funny this link says it can be done http://www.debuntu.org/how-to-install-ubuntu-over-lvm-filesystem
Are you not reading or are you trolling me? I've already told you I have done it before on the CD
and this line sudo apt-get install lvm2  gives you that error?
Cant stat /vmlinuz
